intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: Who recently won the special election for Rhode Island’s 1st U.S. Congressional district?
questions.explanation: Democrat Gabe Amo won the special election for Rhode Island’s 1st Congressional District with 64.8% of the votes, filling the vacancy left by former Rep. David Cicilline ’83 following his resignation in May. His opponent, Republican Gerry Leonard Jr,. lost with 35.2%; Democrat Jacob Bissaillon won the race for a Rhode Island state Senate seat.

questions.question: What were 20 pro-Palestine student activists arrested for Wednesday?
choices: Trespassing in University Hall during a sit-in
questions.explanation: On Oct. 8, BrownU Jews for Ceasefire Now staged a sit-in of University Hall, refusing to voluntarily leave until President Christina Paxson publicly committed to supporting a measure to divest “Israel and the military-industrial complex” and for the University to “protect students from intimidation, doxxing and harassment for their Palestine activism.” Once the building had closed, police began arresting students around 5:45 p.m.

questions.question: Which department recently announced it was revising its concentration requirements?
questions.explanation: On Oct. 23, the Department of Computer Science announced it would reviseits concentration requirements to better prepare students for 1000-level courses. Currently enrolled students planning to concentrate in CS can choose to either continue following the existing requirements or switch to the new ones.

questions.question: Which class year had the highest percentage of respondents say that they were single and looking for love in The Herald’s fall poll?
questions.explanation: The sophomore class had the greatest share of respondents who were single and looking for a relationship, at 28%. More than one-third of respondents who are seniors reported being in a long-term relationship, compared with 30% of juniors, 22% of sophomores and 14% of first-years.

questions.question: A Brown professor recently proved a conjecture about which non-orientable shape?
questions.explanation: Professor of Mathematics Richard Schwartz published a paper proving the Halper-Weaver conjecture nearly 50 years after it was first proposed. The conjecture postulates that the aspect ratio of a Möbius strip must be one to the square root of three.

questions.question: Which Providence mural recently celebrated its five-year anniversary?
questions.explanation: On Nov. 3, the Rhode Island School of Design hosted a celebration of the five-year anniversary of the “Still Here” mural in downtown Providence. The mural, which was painted by Baltimore-based artist Gaia, depicts Narragansett woman Lynsea Montanari and has been hailed for its modern and genuine portrayal of the Narragansett Indian Tribe.

questions.question: Which school did Brown men’s soccer tie to qualify for the Ivy League tournament?
questions.explanation: Brown men’s soccer team (5-4-7, 2-0-5 Ivy League) clinched a postseason berth after a 0-0 draw against Yale (8-5-3, 3-1-3). The Bears’ tie earned them a fourth place finish in the Ivy League standings. They will face off against Penn in the semi-final round of the Ivy League tournament on Nov. 11.

questions.question: Which school did the women’s soccer team fall to in the Ivy League Tournament?
questions.explanation: The Bears lost to Columbia 2-1 on Friday night, marking their first loss to an Ivy opponent since 2018. With the defeat, Bruno failed to earn the conference’s automatic bid to the NCAA Tournament, but received a slot as a three seed.

questions.question: Which week-long event did Biology Undergraduate Education hold from Oct. 29 to Nov. 3?
questions.explanation: Biology Undergraduate Education held its second-ever BioWeek this past week, featuring academic tips and educational events for students interested in concentrations and careers related to the field of biology.

questions.question: What band released their 25th album “The Silver Cord” on Oct. 27.?
questions.explanation: The prolific experimental rock band King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard recently released their 25th album “The Silver Cord,” a synthesizer-heavy electronic sound that swaps hard rock guitar riffs and energetic drumming with spacey piano lines and digital drum loops.
